background_dashed.customLabel: In Adults (>=20 years old),  there is no difference between V1a-RA and controls on Social-communication. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Adults (>=20 years old),  there is no difference between V1a-RA and controls on Acceptability. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Adults (>=20 years old),  there is no difference between V1a-RA and controls on Adverse events. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Adults (>=20 years old),  there is no difference between V1a-RA and controls on Adaptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.
